Courses.title: English for Begginers
Courses.description: In this course, you will learn the basics of English grammar, pronunciation, and essential everyday expressions, starting from the most fundamental concepts.

topics.title: Basic grammar - To be
topics.description: Basic verb forms: be, do, have.

videos.title: Introduction TO BE verb
videos.description: To be is the most common verb in English. In this basic grammar lesson, I will teach you how to use this verb correctly. You will learn the positive, negative, and question forms of to be

videos.title: Verb TO BE tenses
videos.description: Learn about the past, present, and future of the verb to be. What can follow it? What can’t follow it? This is a great lesson for beginners, and for intermediate students who need a reminder.

videos.title: Using “to be” to describe your life
videos.description: The common verb “to be” is one of the most confusing verbs in English. In this basic grammar lesson, I’ll show you how to use this verb to describe the present, past, and future events of your life. You must master these basics to speak good English.

questions.question: Choose the correct answer.
With she/he/it, we use:
With you/they/we, we use:
What are the negative forms of to be?

options.text: am not, is not, are not
not I am, not is he, not are we
not am, not is, not we

questions.question: What is the correct question form of to be?
What is the right way to state where you're from?
What is the correct way to say where you were yesterday?

options.text: I was at home yesterday. I was unwell.
I was at home yesterday. I unwell.
I at home yesterday, I was unwell.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences gives your marital status?
Yesterday, I __________ at home all day.
Which sentence below describes someone's religion correctly?
Which sentence is correct?

options.text: I was go to the park.
I was went to the park.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
Which sentence is correct?
Who is his girlfriend?
Where were you last night?

options.text: I was go to a party.
I was went to a party.

questions.question: When were they there?

options.text: They were dance there all night.

questions.question: Who is the opening act for the concert?

options.text: The opening act is be The Strokes.
The opening act is The Strokes.

questions.question: What is he doing?

options.text: He is go reading a book.

questions.question: What's her job?
When will they be arriving?

topics.title: Basic grammar - Simple present & Pronouns
topics.description: Present tense actions and states of being.

videos.title: Learn English Tenses: PRESENT SIMPLE
videos.description: In this easy English class, you will learn all about the PRESENT SIMPLE TENSE. I’ll teach you how to use it, when to use it, and what mistakes to avoid. This is a full, complete English grammar class for anyone who wants to communicate fluently.

videos.title: Present Simple -WH- QUESTIONS
videos.description: How do you ask questions with the do auxiliary verb? Learn a very common formula in this essential beginner English grammar lesson!

videos.title: Parts of Speech in English Grammar:
videos.description: The first step in building a strong understanding of grammar is knowing all the parts of a sentence, because every word in every sentence fills a role. In this English grammar lesson, you’ll learn about articles (a/the), prepositions (for, by, to, in…), conjunctions (and, but, when, if…), and pronouns (he, it, these, all…).

questions.question: We usually __________ a movie on Saturday night.
__________ enough time to study for the test?
I __________ at 6:00 in the morning. My son __________ at 6:30.
He __________ Portuguese. He only __________ English.
She and I __________ to each other every week.
Which is correct?
Jack always __________ his parents good night.
Do they need a place to stay?
My husband __________ coffee and I __________ tea.
I come from Portugal.
He's a teacher.
They party on Saturday night.
I visit her once a month.

options.text: How often do you visiting her?
How often do you visit her?
How often do you visits her?

questions.question: She teaches piano.
I go to bed at 11.

options.text: When do you go to bed?
When are you go to bed?

questions.question: Class starts at 8:45.
Milla speaks French and Spanish.
I go shopping or see my friends.

options.text: What do you does on the weekend?
What do you shop on the weekend?
What do you on the weekend?
What do you do on the weekend?

questions.question: I want to go to Venice.

options.text: Where do you wants to go on vacation?
Where do you want go on vacation?
Where do you want to go on vacation?
Where do you want to goes on vacation?

videos.title: Prepositions of Place: AT, ON, IN
videos.description: In this lesson, you will learn about three common prepositions of place: AT, ON, and IN. Want to know how to use AT, ON, and IN? Have a look at this video, and improve your English grammar

videos.title: Prepositions of time: How to use IN, AT, and ON in English
videos.description: In this English lesson, I explain how three prepositions — ‘at’, ‘on’, and ‘in’ — are used in relation to time. A lot of students get confused with these words.

videos.title: Which preposition to use in any situation
videos.description: : Prepositions are short words that help us express location, time, and other relationships between people and things. Some examples of prepositions are: on, at, in, and by. Do you know how to use them?

questions.question: _____ 1992, I went to Japan to visit my friend Shingo.
We came here ____ car.
We have to meet Mr E. ____ 9:15 p.m.
Some people have a holiday _____ Christmas day.
____ closing time, I want the store to be completely clean.
Mr E. came ____ from work and caught me eating all his candy.
We went to the airport ___ a taxi.
I was ____ my bicycle when I met Mr E., who was walking down the street.
Lucille and I had our first date ___ the library.
Sweetheart, can we go out for our anniversary dinner ____ a week?
The dog is sitting _____ the floor.
I like to study ____ my bedroom.
My mother lives _____ 345 Terry Ave.
The video store is _____ Park Blvd.
I live ____ Brazil.
Meet me _____ three o'clock in front of the library.
My interview will be held _____ Friday morning.
We're flying to Italy _____ July.
Their wedding is scheduled to be held _____ August 8th.
Craig was supposed to be here _____ noon, but he's late again.
My birthday is _____ June. When's yours?
_____ the fall, the forest is breathtaking!
In North America, Christmas is celebrated _____ December 25th.
Will you be working _____ Saturday?
The concert starts _____ 7 pm. Don't be late!

videos.title: The 25 Most Common Verbs
videos.description: What are the most common English verbs? In this simple and fun lesson, I’ll show you the 25 most common verbs. You need to know these (and you need to know them well!) if you want to become a fluent English speaker. Learn the present, past, and past participle forms of the verbs.

videos.title: Easy English Conversation: 11 Common Social Expressions
videos.description: Improve your conversation skills with this quick and easy lesson. I will teach you 11 common expressions we use when talking with our friends. Most of these expressions are about social situations and spending time with other people.

videos.title: ♥ ♥ ♥ 16 Common English LOVE Expressions ♥ ♥ ♥
videos.description: If you like someone, you might want to let that person know. Or maybe you are already in a relationship and want to talk about it with your friends. To help you express yourself, watch this lesson all about expressions and slang to do with love and relationships.

questions.question: They ______ home all day yesterday.
He ________ two brothers.
I'll ________ the laundry later.
Where did you _________ last night?
You __________ I could trust you.
You should __________ new shoes.
The kids are __________ a lot of noise.
We've __________ each other for eight years.
Let me __________ about that for a moment.
Have you __________ this movie?
She's __________ a philosophy class this semester.
Mariana is __________ over later.
What do you __________ for your birthday?
I've never __________ this kind of product before.
I can't __________ my keys. Has anyone seen them?
Who __________ you that pen?
__________ her the truth!
Where do you __________?
Your mom __________ while you were out.
Don't be afraid to __________ questions.
Have you __________ studying on YouTube?
Do we __________ anything from the grocery store?
I haven't __________ this happy in a long time!
You've __________ a better English speaker!
When are you __________ for work?
Guess who I ran ______ yesterday?
I ran into Peter at the supermarket. This means:

options.text: I had a planned meeting with Peter.
I met Peter. It was not planned.

questions.question: It was nice catching _______ with Peter.
To catch up means:

options.text: to talk with someone about what is happening in your lives
to see a movie with a group of friends
to go to a restaurant and talk about sports or pop culture

questions.question: Please keep me ________.
Keep me posted means:

options.text: let's make a plan to meet up within the next few weeks
continue to inform me about a topic
mail a letter to me soon
talk to me about my job

questions.question: I love ___________ with my friends.
I'm _______ for anything tonight.
I'm up for seeing a movie. This means ____________.

options.text: I am open to seeing a movie.
I don't want to see a movie.
I woke up in order to see a movie.
I have enough money for seeing a movie.

questions.question: I'm hungry. Want to grab a _________?
Elizabeth likes Paul more than just as a friend. She _____________.
Those two clearly like each other. They _________ instantly at the speed dating event.
Some people prefer not to be too obvious and __________. They think it will help them woo their crush. It is like a game to them.
If you have a fling, it means:
Victoria _________ Ean on a picnic date. She hid the ring in his sandwich, and he accidentally ate it.
To tie the knot is another way of saying:
A marriage is made up of two people: you and your __________.
If your relationship is on the rocks, it means:
A hook-up is like a ________.
Valen: So there I was, waiting like a fool at the restaurant. I left after an hour and a half. Gill: I can't believe he ___________!

Courses.title: English for Intermediates
Courses.description: This intermediate English course enhances your grammar, vocabulary, and conversation skills. You'll master complex structures like verb tenses, conditionals, and modal verbs, alongside essential phrasal verbs and idiomatic expressions.

topics.title: Intermediate Grammar
topics.description: Actions completed in the past and hypothetical situations.

videos.title: SIMPLE PAST or PRESENT PERFECT? When + how to use them!
videos.description: “I worked” or “I have worked”? “I went” or “I have gone”? What’s the difference? If you confuse the simple past and present perfect tenses, watch this lesson. You’ll learn how to use both tenses (the structure) and when to use them (the usage).

videos.title: Modals – “could” or “should”?
videos.description: Expectation is what we think could or should happen. But COULD and SHOULD are not the same! This important grammar lesson will teach you how to use these modals correctly, like a native English speaker.

videos.title: Conditionals – zero & first conditionals
videos.description: “If I eat two hamburgers, I will be full.” Conditionals in English grammar are very confusing! Learn what ‘First Conditionals’ and ‘Zero Conditionals’ are, when we use them, and how we use them correctly! I’ll also teach you the differences between them, so you’ll never confuse them again.

questions.question: I __________ to the supermarket yesterday.
__________ your homework?
__________ the same conference last year.
Have you ever played basketball? Which tense is used in this question?
Signal words like yesterday or last month tell us that we should use the __________.
He __________ the email.
The __________ refers to an action that started and finished in the past.
__________ for the job?
I haven't called John __________.
The present perfect tense links the past with the __________.
What is the general meaning of the modal should?

options.text: the best or right thing to do

questions.question: What is the general meaning of the modal could?
Mr. E is on his way to class. He __________ be there in five minutes.
The man over there ______________ be dangerous. Be careful.
I'm on the bus. I ____________ be home in fifteen minutes.
She ______________ be the one to get the job, because she has the most experience.
Mr. E: My GPS isn't working. I'm not sure where we are going. James: We ______________ be going in the wrong direction!
First conditional is used for:
Zero conditionals are used for:
The only difference in structure between first and zero conditionals is:
When the subject is he, she, or it, you need to:

options.text: put the verb in past tense

videos.title: Top 10 Important Phrasal Verbs for Your Daily Routine
videos.description: Learn 10 common phrasal verbs we use every day. First, I will teach you what a phrasal verb is. Then I will teach you how to use: head out, meet up, go out, sleep in, get in, get up, heat up, warm up, work out, and tidy up.

videos.title: 10 PHRASAL VERBS using the prepositions OFF, ON, OVER, UP
videos.description: Did you know that by simply adding a preposition, you can transform normal verbs into phrasal verbs? Prepositions tell us the where, how, and why in a sentence. In this lesson, we will focus on the prepositions off, on, over, and up to form our phrasal verbs.

videos.title: Describe people in English with animal adjectives & idioms
videos.description: Animal expressions are very common in the English language. But in today’s lesson, I want to teach you some animal idioms that are specifically used to describe people. For example, if someone is sheepish, it means they are shy, nervous, and have no confidence.

questions.question: If Josh is interested in dating Jel, he should ___________.
Luke has plans to go out tonight. What does this mean? Choose the best answer.

options.text: Luke will be going outside tonight.
Luke will be doing something fun outside of his home tonight.
Luke has a romantic date tonight.

questions.question: Why don't you __________ for dinner this weekend? It would be nice to catch up.
I like to ___________ to fitness classes at my local gym.
If your plans fell through, it means your plans were _______________.
If you haven't seen someone in a while, and you want to know what activities that person has done, what could you say?

options.text: What have you been up to?

questions.question: Which two phrasal verbs mean the same thing?
Pick up is the opposite of ___________.
If a friend invites you to a party, but you can't go, you could ask for a ______________.
I'm looking forward to our date on Friday. Shall I ____________ at eight?
Which of the following is an example of a phrasal verb?
Which of the following words is an example of a preposition?
I like to sleep ________ on the weekend.
Mary gets ________ at 7 am.
Joaquin heads _______ at 9 am.
I need to heat _____ my lunch.
James works _____ every day.
In the dance class, we always spend 5 minutes warming ________.
Sheila goes _________ with her friends on Friday nights.
Let's meet _________ at 7 pm at the restaurant.
If you have a problem with John, you could say:

options.text: I have a bull with John.
I have a beef with John.

questions.question: Mary is always a bit shy and nervous. You could say:
You have a suspicion that Ali is lying. You could say:

options.text: Ali has a beef with me.
Ali's story seems fishy to me.

questions.question: Someone who is 'chicken' is:
A derogatory slang term for police officers is:
Someone who is a 'pig' is:
Untrustworthy people are referred to as:
Another word for 'stupid' is:
Martha always feels _____________ in the morning because she has trouble sleeping.
A restless and nervous person can be described as:

topics.title: Conversation Skills:
topics.description: Expressing opinions, making suggestions, and debating ideas.

videos.title: How to talk about people & events in the past
videos.description: How do you talk about people and events in your past? I’ll show you three ways to do that, using to be, would, and used to. You’ll learn how these each are used in English in different situations or to convey a particular meaning or mood.

videos.title: SUGGEST & RECOMMEND
videos.description: What is correct: “Can you recommend me a movie?”, “Can you recommend a movie?” or “Can you recommend a movie to me?” Many learners of English make mistakes with recommend and suggest.

videos.title: How to agree or disagree
videos.description: Do you have an opinion? Want to express yourself? Need to tell someone that they are wrong? Watch this lesson to improve your conversational skills, and to learn the best expressions to argue and debate.

questions.question: In slang, if you say someone 'croaked', it means the person __________.
In the present, we say: 'They are not friends.' In the past, we say: 'They __________ friends.'
When I was young, I __________ play the piano, but now I have not played in years.
How could you say, in a polite way, that someone died?
'To pass out' means __________.
Another polite way of saying that someone died is to say: 'He's __________ with us.'
'John is in the ambulance.' How would we say this sentence in the past?

options.text: John will be in the ambulance.

questions.question: Oh, I remember those days! When we were young, we __________ watch TV together as a family.
Slang expressions for dying can be used with:

options.text: only people you don't know well
only close friends that are not affected personally

questions.question: If someone 'dropped dead', it means they __________.
Which sentence is correct?

options.text: Can you suggest me a good book?
Can you recommend me a good book?
Can you recommend a good book?
Can you for me recommend a good book?

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?

options.text: I recommended that she bring a coat.
I recommended she bring a coat.
I suggested that she bring a coat.

questions.question: I recommend __________ Canada.
I suggest ________ more sleep.
Can you suggest _______?
Are 'recommend' and 'suggest' synonyms?
My friend recommends restaurants ________.
I recommend that ______ leaves early.
I suggest _____ we study more.
To be honest, I think __________________ taxes are so high.
If you ___________, the government should pay students for going to school.
I reckon ____________ American economy is in decline.
To agree with someone, you might say: I think so __________.
If I agree with you, I could say:
I agree with my friend. I can say: That's a good circle. That's a good point. That's a good square. That's a good line.
Jane: Personally, I think that having a career is more important than having a family. Cole: Hmmm. ____________________. I think it's important to have children.
You disagree with your sister. You can say: I don't completely go with that hat. I completely go along with that. I don't completely go along with that. I don't completely go that.

options.text: I don't completely go with that hat.
I completely go along with that.
I don't completely go along with that.

questions.question: Cersei: Your father is a traitor. Sansa: _________________ my father would betray the king!
To disagree with someone politely, you could say: I didn't know about that. I don't know about that. I don't now about that. I don't no about that.
